questions.question_id: Are autorouter FPL accepted? Whether yes or no, are there recommended local alternatives?
questions.question_raw: Are autorouter FPL accepted? Whether yes or no, are there recommended local alternatives?
questions.question_text: Are autorouter FPL accepted? Whether yes or no, are there recommended local alternatives?

FR.answer_html: yes

questions.question_id: Are military airfields generally available for civilian use?

questions.question_text: Are military airfields generally available for civilian use?

FR.answer_html: no

questions.question_id: Are there any preferred weather services which particularly report local conditions?
questions.question_raw: Are there any preferred weather services which particularly report local conditions?
questions.question_text: Are there any preferred weather services which particularly report local conditions?

FR.answer_html: https://aviation.meteo.fr, windy

CH.answer_html: meteosuisse app with aviation weather addon, foreflight, GAFOR route particualarly useful

questions.question_id: Are there any specific requirements in the initial call for FIS?
questions.question_raw: Are there any specific requirements in the initial call for FIS?
questions.question_text: Are there any specific requirements in the initial call for FIS?

GB.answer_html: center name, station name, request (service or transit). They wil lreply pass your message and you can then give your details

FR.answer_html: Typically say your registration number, then "CenterName (Paris/Lilleâ€¦) N12345 Bonjour". They will reply "Bonjour N12345" and then you can give your details and request (can be in english or french)

questions.question_id: Are there Listening Squawks and if so, how do they work?
questions.question_raw: Are there Listening Squawks and if so, how do they work?
questions.question_text: Are there Listening Squawks and if so, how do they work?

GB.answer_html: yes, squawk the frequency using mode C or S, Map is found in section 6.80 of latest AIP found here https://nats-uk.ead-it.com/cms-nats/opencms/en/Publications/AIP/

FR.answer_html: no

questions.question_id: Are these rules generally abided by (or do lesser services try to "overcontrol")?
questions.question_raw: Are these rules generally abided by (or do lesser services try to "overcontrol")?
questions.question_text: Are these rules generally abided by (or do lesser services try to "overcontrol")?

FR.answer_html: usualy abided

questions.question_id: Can FIS grant clearance through Class D, C and B airspace?
questions.question_raw: Can FIS grant clearance through Class D, C and B airspace?
questions.question_text: Can FIS grant clearance through Class D, C and B airspace?

GB.answer_html: no FIS, only the controlling station can provide clearance

FR.answer_html: depends, sometime yes, sometime they will direct you to contact the relevant unit on the radio

questions.question_id: Can you rely on FIS to advise you regarding approaching and penetrating such airspace?
questions.question_raw: Can you rely on FIS to advise you regarding approaching and penetrating such airspace?
questions.question_text: Can you rely on FIS to advise you regarding approaching and penetrating such airspace?

FR.answer_html: usually if workload permits. You can also ask for active zone ahead

questions.question_id: Do any specific requirements or procedures apply when arriving on an instrument approach to an unmanned airfield?
questions.question_raw: Do any specific requirements or procedures apply when arriving on an instrument approach to an unmanned airfield?
questions.question_text: Do any specific requirements or procedures apply when arriving on an instrument approach to an unmanned airfield?

FR.answer_html: If the circuit is active you need to overfly the field and not do a straight in approach.

FR.answer_html: yes

questions.question_id: Flying under VFR, what are the requirements to enter Class D and Class C airspace?
questions.question_raw: Flying under VFR, what are the requirements to enter Class D and Class C airspace?
questions.question_text: Flying under VFR, what are the requirements to enter Class D and Class C airspace?

GB.answer_html: You need an explicit clearance from the controlling station. Do not enter until you heard "Cleared to enter airspace"

FR.answer_html: Class D, usually be in contact with ATC. Class C/TMA Be in contact with ATC and ask for transit. Reply will typically be "approved" with potential routing

CH.answer_html: Radio communication for D, clearance for C (ex geneva tma)

questions.question_id: For Airfield Information service-What permissions are required in the air?
questions.question_raw: What permissions are required in the air?
questions.question_text: For Airfield Information service, what permissions are required in the air?

GB.answer_html: Establish radio contact required, say your intention and position, and you'll get traffic and field information.

FR.answer_html: Establish radio contact required, say your intention and position, and you'll get traffic and field information.

questions.question_id: For Airfield Information service-What permissions are required on taxiways and aprons?
questions.question_raw: What permissions are required on taxiways and aprons?
questions.question_text: For Airfield Information service, what permissions are required on taxiways and aprons?

GB.answer_html: report position, intention. you'll get traffic and field information, not permission or clearance will be given. Pilot discretion

FR.answer_html: report position, intention. you'll get traffic and field information, not permission or clearance will be given. Pilot discretion

CH.answer_html: report position, intention. you'll get traffic and field information, not permission or clearance will be given. Pilot discretion

FR.answer_html: Announce position and intention, coordinate with other planes

questions.question_raw: What permissions are required in the air?

FR.answer_html: Radio contact and follow instructions

CH.answer_html: enter zone by radio contact, no explicit clearance for D

questions.question_id: For ATC at an airfield:-What permissions are required on taxiways and aprons?
questions.question_raw: What permissions are required on taxiways and aprons?
questions.question_text: For ATC at an airfield, what permissions are required on taxiways and aprons?

GB.answer_html: start for IFR and VFR, taxi clearance required

FR.answer_html: start for IFR, taxi clearance required and typical to ask permission to leave frequency before shutdown

CH.answer_html: start for IFR, taxi for VFR

questions.question_id: For ATC at an airfield:-What permissions are required on the runway (ie take-off and land)?

questions.question_text: For ATC at an airfield, what permissions are required on the runway (ie take-off and land)?

FR.answer_html: Takeoff and landing clearance required

questions.question_id: How are FPL closed when arriving on a non-controlled airport?
questions.question_raw: How are FPL closed when arriving on a non-controlled airport?
questions.question_text: How are FPL closed when arriving on a non-controlled airport?

GB.answer_html: not required (no search and rescue will be triggered)

FR.answer_html: either by calling phone number provided by ATC in the air (common) or +33 1 56 30 13 01

questions.question_id: How far from destination would you generally first call a VFR airfield?
questions.question_raw: How far from destination would you generally first call a VFR airfield?
questions.question_text: How far from destination would you generally first call a VFR airfield?

FR.answer_html: 5 to 10 NM or 5 min

CH.answer_html: downwind join, with overhead check of airfield if no afis. Base or straightin possible if communication/coordination with afis or tower

questions.question_id: If arriving at a VFR airfield following an IFR flight, who is permitted to terminate IFR, and under what circumstance?
questions.question_raw: If arriving at a VFR airfield following an IFR flight, who is permitted to terminate IFR, and under what circumstance?
questions.question_text: If arriving at a VFR airfield following an IFR flight, who is permitted to terminate IFR, and under what circumstance?

GB.answer_html: Once leaving controlled airspace, it becomes pilot discretion

FR.answer_html: You can continue IFR until after landing. ATC or AFIS will closed your flight plan, if no ATC, you need to call to close it (it is common to receive the phone number in the air from ATC). It is important to close your flight plan, as not doing so will trigger search and rescue in France

questions.question_id: If IFR practical in Class G, is a clearance required?
questions.question_raw: If IFR practical in Class G, is a clearance required?
questions.question_text: If IFR practical in Class G, is a clearance required?

FR.answer_html: yes, you need to be in contact with ATC

questions.question_id: If IFR practical in Class G, is an ATC service required?
questions.question_raw: If IFR practical in Class G, is an ATC service required?
questions.question_text: If IFR practical in Class G, is an ATC service required?

FR.answer_html: yes

questions.question_id: If IFR practical in Class G, is an FPL required, if so, does that FPL have to filed before flight?
questions.question_raw: If IFR practical in Class G, is an FPL required, if so, does that FPL have to filed before flight?
questions.question_text: If IFR practical in Class G, is an FPL required, if so, does that FPL have to filed before flight?

FR.answer_html: FPL should be filed, if not IFR FPL, ATS can give you a clearance in the air

questions.question_id: If joining IFR from a VFR airfield what are the requirements in terms of clearances to start IFR?
questions.question_raw: If joining IFR from a VFR airfield what are the requirements in terms of clearances to start IFR?
questions.question_text: If joining IFR from a VFR airfield what are the requirements in terms of clearances to start IFR?

GB.answer_html: Depart VFR or IFR outside controlled airspace and call London Information for join on the radio. Some airport will list in the AIP phone number and procedure when uncontrolled

FR.answer_html: You can depart VFR and call ATC to get your clearance. If you can't depart VFR, you can get your clearance on the ground by calling relevant unit phone number listed in AIP or by local knowledge

CH.answer_html: request start, get squawk and get frequency to call for the join

FR.answer_html: not applicable

questions.question_id: Is there a preferred way to file an FPL (VFR & IFR)?
questions.question_raw: Is there a preferred way to file an FPL (VFR & IFR)?
questions.question_text: Is there a preferred way to file an FPL (VFR & IFR)?

FR.answer_html: autorouter, foreflight

questions.question_id: My country is:
questions.question_raw: My country is:
questions.question_text: My country is:

FR.answer_html: France

questions.question_id: Please describe anything odd or unusual about flying in your country not already covered.
questions.question_raw: Please describe anything odd or unusual about flying in your country not already covered.
questions.question_text: Please describe anything odd or unusual about flying in your country not already covered.

GB.answer_html: uncoordinated system of FIS/radar facility, you will need initiate new contact each time. Multiple class of service (Basic Service, Traffic Service, Deconfliction), zero tolerance for airspace infringement

FR.answer_html: Airport, AIP, maps available in https://www.sia.aviation-civile.gouv.fr  select AIP/eAIP, quite a few airport have noise area that you need to respect or risk a warning letter (ex LFPN, LFMD to name a few). Quite a few airport have Visual Prescribed Track procedure after IFR approach, some airport have the approach broken down in two plates INA (contain IAF) and FNA (contains final approach) make sure you study both

CH.answer_html: Subscribing to the Skyguide manual is recommended as it contains most relevant information, for example the VFR manual and airport information. EFB have option to purchase (for example foreflight) or subscribe to https://skybriefing.com

questions.question_id: 2) Abided by?
questions.question_raw: 2) Abided by?
questions.question_text: Under VFR, how strictly are the rules about semicircle + 500' Abided by?

FR.answer_html: usually

questions.question_raw: 1) Enforced?

FR.answer_html: If in contact with ATC they will ask you to choose a compliant altitude if you don't

questions.question_text: What are general rules, views and attitudes towards cloudbreak at an airport followed by VFR transit to an airfield?

GB.answer_html: common in class G and pilot discretion

FR.answer_html: Possible, you need to maintain VFR

questions.question_id: What are the accepted norms for joining a visual circuit?
questions.question_raw: What are the accepted norms for joining a visual circuit?
questions.question_text: What are the accepted norms for joining a visual circuit?

FR.answer_html: downwind join, with overhead check of airfield if no afis. Base or straightin possible if communication/coordination with afis or tower

CH.answer_html: downwind join, with overhead check of airfield if no afis. Base or straightin possible if communication/coordination with afis or tower

questions.question_id: What are the rules and general practices for approaching an airfield without IAPs in poor weather?
questions.question_raw: What are the rules and general practices for approaching an airfield without IAPs in poor weather?
questions.question_text: What are the rules and general practices for approaching an airfield without IAPs in poor weather?

GB.answer_html: if outside controlled airspace pilot discretion, if inside controlled airspace minimum will be listed

FR.answer_html: You need to become VFR by either using another airfield approach or descend to MSA while in contact with ATC for class G

questions.question_id: What are the rules and normal practices regarding penetration of:-Danger Areas
questions.question_raw: Danger Areas
questions.question_text: What are the rules and normal practices regarding penetration of Danger Areas
questions.question_prefix: What are the rules and normal practices regarding penetration of:

GB.answer_html: Do not enter, you may ask for transit but not always possible. Information about the areas can be found in the official AIP https://nats-uk.ead-it.com/cms-nats/opencms/en/Publications/AIP/ section 5 search for EGDnnn

FR.answer_html: N/A only R and P zone

questions.question_id: What are the rules and normal practices regarding penetration of:-Gliding Launch Sites
questions.question_raw: Gliding Launch Sites
questions.question_text: What are the rules and normal practices regarding penetration of Gliding Launch Sites
questions.question_prefix: What are the rules and normal practices regarding penetration of:

GB.answer_html: Avoid, some service may warn you of possible activity

FR.answer_html: ATC will notify you gliding activities

CH.answer_html: ATC will notify you gliding activities

questions.question_id: What are the rules and normal practices regarding penetration of:-Military Areas
questions.question_raw: Military Areas
questions.question_text: What are the rules and normal practices regarding penetration of Military Areas
questions.question_prefix: What are the rules and normal practices regarding penetration of:

GB.answer_html: MTZ in class G can be entered.

FR.answer_html: See Restricted Area

questions.question_id: What are the rules and normal practices regarding penetration of:-Parachute Areas
questions.question_raw: Parachute Areas
questions.question_text: What are the rules and normal practices regarding penetration of Parachute Areas
questions.question_prefix: What are the rules and normal practices regarding penetration of:

GB.answer_html: FIS may warn you of parachute activity

FR.answer_html: ATC will notify you parachute activity and ask you to avoid

CH.answer_html: ATC will notify you parachute activity and ask you to avoid

questions.question_id: What are the rules and normal practices regarding penetration of:-Prohibited Zones
questions.question_raw: Prohibited Zones
questions.question_text: What are the rules and normal practices regarding penetration of Prohibited Zones
questions.question_prefix: What are the rules and normal practices regarding penetration of:

FR.answer_html: do not enter

questions.question_id: What are the rules and normal practices regarding penetration of:-Restricted Areas
questions.question_raw: Restricted Areas
questions.question_text: What are the rules and normal practices regarding penetration of Restricted Areas
questions.question_prefix: What are the rules and normal practices regarding penetration of:

FR.answer_html: Requirement and activations of R zone vary a lot. Some are only requiring radio communication (for ex around Paris), some can't be entered, some activated by notam or by ATC. You can review information on the french eAIP, go to section ENR 5.1 and search for the zone using the syntax "LF R nnn" to get the details. For temporary area you can find if applicable the SUP information on the same website, select preflight briefing, AIP Suplement, AIP SUP Metropole

CH.answer_html: Condition Varies. You can find the condition for each in the VFR Manual, For ex Restricted Area 4, search for "LSR4" to find the official information

questions.question_id: What are the rules and practicality of arriving Non-Schengen?
questions.question_raw: What are the rules and practicality of arriving Non-Schengen?
questions.question_text: What are the rules and practicality of arriving Non-Schengen?

GB.answer_html: Use a designated airport listed here https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/general-aviation-operators-and-pilots-notification-of-flights/general-aviation-report-guidance-accessible

FR.answer_html: Use a port of entry listed here https://www.legifrance.gouv.fr/jorf/id/JORFTEXT000043547009 check on the AIP for each airport the rules on PPR or PN as they vary quite a bit

CH.answer_html: Usually airport have PN. You can find list of airport with custom here https://www.bazg.admin.ch/bazg/en/home/information-individuals/declaring-goods/importation-into-switzerland/crossborder-flights.html

questions.question_id: What are the rules for joining a visual circuit?
questions.question_raw: What are the rules for joining a visual circuit?
questions.question_text: What are the rules for joining a visual circuit?

FR.answer_html: downwind join, with overhead check of airfield if no afis. Base or straightin possible if communication/coordination with afis or tower

CH.answer_html: downwind join and overhead check of parameters

questions.question_id: What are the rules pertaining to the use of local language?
questions.question_raw: What are the rules pertaining to the use of local language?
questions.question_text: What are the rules pertaining to the use of local language?

FR.answer_html: You can use local language (french) or english. Some airport will have restriction for French only indicated in the VAC plate, some will revert to French only when ATS is not active

CH.answer_html: You can always use english with ATC, airfield or FIS will support an additional local language as well. Ex: Geneva French, Bern German, etc

questions.question_id: What electronic conspicuity is generally in use in your country?
questions.question_raw: What electronic conspicuity is generally in use in your country?
questions.question_text: What electronic conspicuity is generally in use in your country?

FR.answer_html: SDVFR, skydemon, foreflight,
